title: Hello World
explanation: Every language has a way to show text. In Python, you use the print() function.
task: Change the code to print your name instead.
hint: Replace 'Hello, world!' with your own name.

title: Variables
explanation: Variables store information you want to use later. Use = to assign a value.
task: Create a variable called age and set it to your age. Then print it.

title: Data Types
explanation: Python has numbers, strings, and booleans as common data types.
example:
name = "James"  # string
age = 28      # int
is_happy = True  # boolean
task: Create one variable of each type.
hint: Use quotes for strings, numbers directly, and True/False for booleans.

title: User Input
explanation: You can ask the user for input using input().
example:
name = input("What's your name? ")
print("Hello, " + name)
task: Ask the user for their favorite color and print it.
hint: Use: input("Question?") and then print it

title: Comments
explanation: Comments start with # and are ignored by Python.
task: Write a comment above a print statement.

title: Arithmetic
explanation: You can add (+), subtract (-), multiply (*), and divide (/) numbers.
task: Do a math operation of your choice.

title: Strings
explanation: Strings are text. You can combine them using +.
task: Combine two strings with a space in between.

title: String Formatting
explanation: Use f-strings to insert values into text.
task: Use an f-string to print your name and age.

title: Lists
explanation: Lists store multiple items in one variable.
task: Make a list of 3 foods and print the second one.

title: If Statements
explanation: Use if to run code only when a condition is true.
task: Check if a number is positive.

title: Else Statements
explanation: Use else for what happens if the condition is false.
task: Use if/else to say if a number is even or odd.

title: Elif
explanation: Use elif for more than two choices.
task: Use if/elif/else to check number ranges.

title: Loops - While
explanation: A while loop repeats while a condition is true.
task: Print numbers 1 to 3 using while.

title: Loops - For
explanation: A for loop goes through a list or range.
task: Print each letter in a name using a loop.

title: Functions
explanation: Functions group code to reuse. Define with def.
task: Write a function that prints your favorite food.

title: Function Parameters
explanation: You can pass info to functions using parameters.
task: Make a function that takes 2 numbers and prints their sum.

title: Return Values
explanation: Functions can return values instead of printing.
task: Return the cube of a number.

title: Dictionaries
explanation: Dictionaries store key-value pairs.
task: Make a dict for a pet with 2 traits.

title: Boolean Logic
explanation: You can combine conditions using and/or.
task: Check if age is 18 and name is 'Sam'

title: Nested Conditions
explanation: You can put ifs inside ifs.
task: Use a nested if to check 2 things.
